Customer Service Specialist Job at Carlcare Development Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Carlcare Development Nigeria Limited is the Nigerian subsidiary of Transsion Holdings, the global leader behind TECNO, Infinix, itel, Oraimo, Syinix, and Carlcare. The company drives innovation and customer satisfaction across mobile devices, accessories, and services, while fostering a dynamic workplace where employees can grow and thrive.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Specialist

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Contract

Job Summary 
     

            
    




	We are seeking a courteous and proactive Customer Service Specialist to join our team in Ikeja.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for attending to customer inquiries, resolving complaints, and ensuring a positive customer experience across all touchpoints.


Key Responsibilities


	Handle customer inquiries, complaints, and requests promptly and professionally
	Provide accurate information about company products and services
	Maintain proper records of customer interactions and resolutions
	Follow up with customers to ensure issues are fully resolved
	Escalate complex issues to the appropriate department when necessary
	Maintain a positive and professional company image at all times


Requirements


	Minimum of OND / HND / BSc in any discipline
	Proven experience in a customer service role is an added advantage
	Good communication and interpersonal skills
	Strong problem-solving and listening skills
	Basic computer proficiency (Microsoft Office, CRM tools).


 Salary
 N150,000 - N170,000 per month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: adebayo.deborah@transsion.com using "Customer Service Specialist– Ikeja" as the subject of the mail.

	The Business Development / Relationship Officer will be responsible for driving capital inflows, managing investor relationships, and supporting the promotion of the structured investment products within Casalavoro Limited&rsquo;s Investment Unit.

Business Development Officer Job at CasaLavoro Limited




        
    

        
        CasaLavoro Limited is committed to delivering top-quality projects and services across various industries such as real estate and hospitality. 

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Officer

Job Location: Wuse 2, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Description
     

            
    




	The Business Development / Relationship Officer will be responsible for driving capital inflows, managing investor relationships, and supporting the promotion of the structured investment products within Casalavoro Limited’s Investment Unit.
	The role requires a strong balance of relationship management, deal sourcing, investment advisory support, and revenue generation, while ensuring compliance with internal policies and regulatory standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify, originate, and onboard new investors, including HNIs, institutional clients, and corporate investors.
	Drive capital mobilization for the company’s investment products, real estate-backed instruments, and structured offerings.
	Develop and execute business development strategies aligned with the company’s investment objectives and growth targets.
	Build and maintain a strong pipeline of prospective investors and strategic partners
	Serve as the primary relationship manager for assigned investment clients.
	Maintain regular communication with clients, providing updates on portfolio performance, deal progress, and new opportunities.
	Ensure high levels of client satisfaction, retention, and repeat investments.
	Manage investor onboarding documentation and KYC requirements in collaboration with Compliance and Operations teams.
	Support the structuring and distribution of investment products, including real estate investments, private placements, and partnerships.
	Assist in preparing investment proposals, pitch decks, term sheets, and client presentations.
	Liaise with internal teams (Legal, Finance, Risk, and Operations) to ensure seamless execution of investment transactions.
	Conduct market research to identify trends, competitor activity, and emerging investment opportunities.
	Provide periodic reports on business development activities, pipeline status, and capital raised.
	Maintain accurate records of client interactions and investment commitments.
	Ensure all client engagements and investment activities comply with internal policies and applicable regulatory requirements (when applicable)
	Uphold confidentiality and ethical standards in all client and deal-related matters.


Qualifications & Experience


	BSC / HND in Finance, Business Administration, Economics, Accounting, or a related discipline.
	Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in business development, relationship management, investment advisory, or financial services
	Relevant professional certifications (e.g., CIBN, CFA) will be an added advantage.


Required Skill Set:


	Strong understanding of investment products, capital markets, and real estate-backed investments.
	Proven ability in business development, sales, and relationship management within financial services or investment firms.
	Sound knowledge of investment documentation, client onboarding, and transaction processes.
	Ability to analyze investment opportunities and communicate value propositions clearly to clients.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@casalavoro.net using the Job Position as subject of the mail.
